edu.rit.pj2

Class Chunk

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.Tuple
      • edu.rit.pj2.Chunk
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable, Cloneable

    public class Chunk
extends Tuple
    Class Chunk is a Tuple specifying the iterations of a loop with an index of type int. A chunk has lower bound, upper bound, and stride fields. Use a chunk to control a for loop as follows. Note that the loop index goes from the lower bound to the upper bound inclusive. 

         Chunk chunk = ...;
     for (int i = chunk.lb(); i <= chunk.ub(); i += chunk.stride())
        {
        ...
        }

    If the stride is known to be 1 (the default), the for loop can be coded this way: 

         Chunk chunk = ...;
     for (int i = chunk.lb(); i <= chunk.ub(); ++ i)
        {
        ...
        }

    If a chunk's lower bound is greater than the upper bound, it represents a loop with no iterations. If a chunk's lower bound is less than or equal to the upper bound, it represents a loop with one or more iterations. The stride must be positive. This restricts the possible loops to those whose loop index increases from the lower bound to the upper bound. You can obtain other loop index patterns by transforming an increasing loop index. For example, here is a code fragment that counts from 10 down to 0: 

         Chunk chunk = new Chunk() .lb (0) .ub (10);
     for (int i = chunk.lb(); i <= chunk.ub(); ++ i)
        System.out.printf ("%d%n", chunk.ub() - i);

    A chunk also has a rank field for use in a cluster parallel program. If a chunk must be processed by a specific worker task, the rank field is set to the worker task's rank (≥ 0). If a chunk can be processed by any worker task, the rank field is set to ANY.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ANY
      Designates that the chunk may be processed by any worker task.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chunk

        public Chunk()
        Construct a new chunk. The rank is ANY. The lower bound, upper bound, and stride are 0, 0, and 1, respectively.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Determine if this chunk is empty. If lb ≤ ub, then this chunk is not empty; otherwise, this chunk is empty.
        Returns:
        True if this chunk is empty, false if it isn't.

      • length

        public long length()
        Get this chunk's length. The length is the number of loop iterations specified by this chunk. If lb ≤ ub, the length is ub-lb+1; otherwise, the length is 0. (The stride does not affect the length.) The return value is type long because a chunk's length can be larger than the largest possible int value.
        Returns:
        Length.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int val)
        Determine if this chunk contains the given value. This is so if lb ≤ val ≤ ub. (The stride does not affect the answer.)
        Parameters:
        val - Value.
        Returns:
        True if this chunk contains val, false otherwise.

      • matchContent

        public boolean matchContent(Tuple target)
        Determine if the given target tuple's content matches this template's content. The target tuple is assumed to be an instance of this template's matching class or a subclass thereof.

        There is a match if any of these conditions is true:

        • The template's rank is ANY.
        • The target's rank is ANY.
        • The template's rank is equal to the target's rank.
        Overrides:
        matchContent in class Tuple
        Parameters:
        target - Target tuple.
        Returns:
        True if the target tuple's content matches this template tuple's content, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if target is null.

      • partitions

        public static Chunk[] partitions(int lb,
                 int ub,
                 int n)
        Partition the given loop index range into a series of chunks, and return all the chunks. Each chunk is the same size (except possibly the last chunk).
        Parameters:
        lb - Loop index lower bound.
        ub - Loop index upper bound.
        n - Number of chunks (≥ 1).
        Returns:
        An n-element array of chunks. The rank of each chunk in the array is equal to the array index.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if n is illegal.

      • partition

        public static Chunk partition(int lb,
              int ub,
              int n,
              int r)
        Partition the given loop index range into a series of chunks, and return one of the chunks. Each chunk is the same size (except possibly the last chunk). The chunk with rank r is returned.
        Parameters:
        lb - Loop index lower bound.
        ub - Loop index upper bound.
        n - Number of chunks (≥ 1).
        r - Rank of the desired chunk (0 ≤ r < n).
        Returns:
        An n-element array of chunks. The rank of each chunk in the array is equal to the array index.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if n or r is illegal.
